Description: Fragment of oval handle of a probably Rhodian pottery transport amphora, gradual curve. Clay fine orange-red. Rectangular stamp with Greek inscription.
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary 1884-5 (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 128, 2. Name Astos. The size and clay of the piece is more akin to that of 'Boethos' handles than 'regular' early Rhodian production. A stamp probably from the same die, from Koroni, Attica, is taken by Grace to be Rhodian (Hesperia 32 (1963) 319. The production is also discussed by B.Schmaltz, Die Hellenistischen Amphorenstempel vom Kaunos (Asia Minor Studien 79) 76-7, KA 175.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0525)
